content: I just posted a StackOverflow question. Maybe it'll shed some light on the situation: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5983059/why-is-a-linkedlist-generally-slower-than-a-list
post_title: LinkedList Always Slower than a List in C#?
author: JP

content: No, unfortunately I haven't. It's really quite strange. Let me know if you find anything...
post_title: LinkedList Always Slower than a List in C#?
author: JP

content: I've noticed the same thing with LinkedList. Also, InsertLast seems to be significantly slower than AddFirst. I had the same thought as you; that a LinkedList would be more efficient because unlike List it doesn't have to dynamically resize.  Did you ever find an explanation for this?
post_title: LinkedList Always Slower than a List in C#?
author: rally25rs
